articles.title: Commemorative Coins to Be Minted
articles.content:
Commemorative Coins to Be Minted 
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Commemorative coins "The 60th Anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea" and "The 60th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation" will be minted.
 According to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK dated July 20, the DPRK Central Bank will mint gold and silver commemorative coins reflecting the will of the army and people of the DPRK to significantly celebrate the 60th anniversaries of the glorious WPK and the liberation of Korea as the great national events and eternally glorify the proud history and undying feats of the WPK and the DPRK.    
 The illustrations, sizes and composition of these commemorative coins have been approved, says the decree.

Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum 
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires a.i. Caridad Adela Galan Pelegrino and staff members of the Cuban embassy here Tuesday visited the Korean Revolution Museum on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
  The guests went round with keen interest relics and materials, being briefed on the fact that upon returning home in triumph after achieving the historic cause of national liberation, President Kim Il Sung laid down the line of building the party, the state and the army and wisely led the Korean people in their struggle to build an independent and sovereign state.    
 At the end of the visit the charge d'affaires said that Kim Il Sung made long journeys of bloody battles to liberate Korea.

articles.title: Reception Given by Palestinian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Palestinian Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Shaher Mohammed Abdlah hosted a reception at the embassy Tuesday in the run-up to the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 Present there on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned.
 The ambassador in his speech said he was glad to join the Korean people in celebrating the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation. On this significant day I would like to recall the feats eternal President Kim Il Sung performed by achieving the great victory in the battles to liberate Korea, he noted, and continued:    
 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people are maintaining the just stand on the international arena. We Palestinians have realized the might of the Songun politics of the DPRK, the might of the single-minded unity of the Korean people in their struggle to defend the country and the nation.    
 The leadership and people of the DPRK have extended support and solidarity to the Palestinian people in their cause of building an independent state under the leadership of Chief of the National Authority Mahmoud Abbas. The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Yasser Arafat and Kim Il Sung who are immortal are growing stronger under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.
 He expressed the conviction that the Korean people, rallied close around Kim Jong Il, will register greater success in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and reunify the country without fail by the concerned efforts of the Koreans free from foreign interference.

More Foreign guests Here
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Vice-President of the World Peace Council Kamal Hyder, who is secretary general of the Bangladeshi Peace Council,  President of the International Association of Democratic Lawyers Jitendra Sharma and a delegation of the National Lawyers Guild of the United States arrived in Pyongyang today to attend the international meeting for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea to be held on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea. 
 Earlier, on Tuesday arriving here by train to attend the international meeting and the Meeting Dedicated to the Great Persons of Mt. Paektu were Coordinator of the Philippines Asian Women's Human Rights Council Nelia Sancho who is executive chairwoman of the Philippines-DPRK Friendship Society, Vice-President of the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula Angelita Bueser, a delegation of the Solidarity Committee "Korea Is One" of Belgium headed by Secretary General Catherine Dijon, and Zhang Qi, grandson of anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Zhang Weihua.

Foreign Delegations Here
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Turkey led by Yalcin Buyukdagli, member of the Political Bureau of its Central Committee, arrived here Tuesday.
 Also arriving was a Cambodian government cultural delegation led by Prince Sisowath Kulachad, secretary of State in the Ministry of Culture and Fine Art of Cambodia.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations and Delegates Here to Attend Int'l Gathering
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations and Delegates Here to Attend Int'l Gathering
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Representatives of international organizations, delegations and delegates of organizations in different countries arrived here on Tuesday to participate in the Meeting Dedicated to Great Persons of Mt. Paektu and the International Meeting for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea to be held on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 They are Robert Charvin, secretary general of the International Commission of Jurists supporting the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and honorary chairman of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea (CILRECO); Paulette Pierson, honorary chairman of CILRECO; Guy Dupre, secretary general of CILRECO; Marcia de Campos Pereira, president of the Women's International Democratic Federation; C.P. Message of Greetings to Chadian President
articles.content:
Message of Greetings to Chadian President
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Idriss Deby, president of Chad, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of its independence. 
 Hoping that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished him and the people of Chad great success in their work for national unity and the development of the country.

articles.title: Friendly Ties Opened between DPRK and Ecuadorian Cities

Friendly Ties Opened between DPRK and Ecuadorian Cities
    Nampho, August 10 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing sister city relations between Nampho, South Phyongan Province of the DPRK, and Loja, Loja Province of Ecuador, was signed here today.
 It was inked by Ri Ho Hyon, chairman of the Nampho City People's Committee, and the mayor of Loja City.

articles.title: Russian Dancing Troupe Here

Russian Dancing Troupe Here
    Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Russia's Beryozka dancing troupe led by Mira Koltsova, head of the State Academy Beryozka Dancing Troupe Named after N. S. Nadezhdina, arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport by Vice Department Director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Kwon Hyok Bong, officials concerned and Councilor of the Russian embassy here Mikhail Vetrov.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Working Contact for Cooperation in Marine Transport
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Working Contact for Cooperation in Marine Transport
    Munsan, August 10 (KCNA Correspondent) -- The fifth inter-Korean working contact for cooperation in marine transport was held in Munsan, south Korea, between August 8 and 10.
 At the contact, both sides discussed practical matters arising in fully implementing the bilateral agreement on marine transport which had already been made in the basic spirit of the June 15 joint declaration, and the appendix for its materialization. And they made public a joint press release.    
 According to the press release, the north and the south of Korea agreed to start on August 15 the passage of the north's civilian ships through Jeju straits and each other's use of sea routes in their waters during direct sailing toward designated ports.
 They also decided to operate the cable communication between the marine authorities of the two sides through the Panmunjom line from August 12.    
 The two sides agreed to make efforts to ensure within this year the long distance direct communication by use of equipment installed on ships so that ships of each side can exchange with their marine institutions or agencies or with marine authorities of both sides information necessary for their navigation during voyage or anchorage.
 They agreed to call the body for bilateral marine consultation "North-South Council for Marine Transport Cooperation" and fix the date and place of its first meeting through the exchange of documents.
